SYSTICK - System Tick Timer
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for interfacing with the System Tick (SYSTICK) timer on Apollo5 devices. It supports system tick timer configuration, interrupt handling, and precise timing control for operating system and application timing requirements.

Key Features

  1. System Timer: Core system tick timer functionality.
  2. Interrupt Support: Configurable interrupt generation.
  3. Clock Sources: Support for internal and external clock sources.
  4. Precise Timing: Accurate timing control and measurement.
  5. Load Control: Configurable timer load values and counting.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure SYSTICK timer
  • Start, stop, and control timer operations
  • Handle SYSTICK interrupts and status monitoring
  • Configure timer load values and counting
  • Support for precise timing measurements

Usage

  1. Initialize SYSTICK using am_hal_systick_init()
  2. Start the timer with am_hal_systick_start()
  3. Configure interrupts and load values as needed
  4. Handle SYSTICK interrupts and timing events
  5. Stop the timer when no longer needed

Configuration

  • Clock Sources: Select internal or external clock sources
  • Load Values: Configure timer load and count values
  • Interrupts: Set up interrupt sources and handlers
  • Timing: Configure precise timing parameters

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_systick_count()

uint32_t am_hal_systick_count ( void )

Get the current count value in the SYSTICK.

This function gets the current count value in the systick timer.

Returns
Current count value.

◆ am_hal_systick_delay_us()

uint32_t am_hal_systick_delay_us ( uint32_t ui32NumUs)
extern

Delay the specified number of microseconds.

This function will use the SysTick timer to delay until the specified number of microseconds have elapsed. It uses the processor clocks and takes into account the current CORESEL setting.

Parameters
ui32NumUsNumber of usecs to Wait
Note
If the SysTick timer is being used elsewhere, it will be corrupted by calling this function.
Returns
Total number of SysTick ticks delayed.

◆ am_hal_systick_init()

uint32_t am_hal_systick_init ( am_hal_systick_t eClockSource)

Initialize the SYSTICK.

This function initialize the systick timer for operation.

Note
The SYSTICK timer can have either internal (Core) clock or external reference clock.
Returns
status.

◆ am_hal_systick_load()

void am_hal_systick_load ( uint32_t ui32LoadVal)

Load the value into the SYSTICK.

Parameters
ui32LoadValthe desired load value for the systick. Maximum value is 0x00FF.FFFF.

This function loads the desired value into the systick timer.

◆ am_hal_systick_reset()

void am_hal_systick_reset ( void )

Reset the interrupt in the SYSTICK.

This function resets the systick timer by clearing out the configuration register.

◆ am_hal_systick_start()

void am_hal_systick_start ( void )

Start the SYSTICK.

This function starts the systick timer.

Note
This timer does not run in deep-sleep mode as it runs from the core clock, which is gated in deep-sleep. If a timer is needed in deep-sleep use one of the ctimers instead. Also to note is this timer will consume higher power than the ctimers.

◆ am_hal_systick_stop()

void am_hal_systick_stop ( void )

Stop the SYSTICK.

This function stops the systick timer.

Note
This timer does not run in deep-sleep mode as it runs from the core clock, which is gated in deep-sleep. If a timer is needed in deep-sleep use one of the ctimers instead. Also to note is this timer will consume higher power than the ctimers.

◆ am_hal_systick_ticks_per_ms()

uint32_t am_hal_systick_ticks_per_ms ( uint32_t * ui32TickPerMs)

Return the number of ticks per millisecond.

This function returns the number of SysTick ticks per millisecond.

Parameters
ui32TicksPerMsNumber of Ticks per millisecond.
Returns
0 if successful.

◆ am_hal_systick_wait_ticks()

uint32_t am_hal_systick_wait_ticks ( uint32_t ui32Ticks)

Wait the specified number of ticks.

This function delays for the given number of SysTick ticks.

Parameters
ui32TicksNumber of Ticks to Wait
Note
If the SysTick timer is being used elsewhere, it will be corrupted by calling this function.
Returns
0 if successful.
